alert.note: Alert for Mariposa-Madera Lower Sierra; Yosemite NP outside of the valley; Yosemite Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 2:51PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTH CENTRAL MARIPOSA AND SOUTHWESTERN TUOLUMNE COUNTIES THROUGH 330 PM PDT... At 250 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles north of Yosemite Valley, or 21 miles southwest of Twin Lakes, moving southwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Tamarack Flat Campground, Gin Flat, Crane Flat Campground, White Wolf Campground, Yosemite Creek Campground, Rancheria Falls Wilderness Campground, Crane Flat, and Hodgdon Meadow Campground. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Mariposa-Madera Lower Sierra; Yosemite NP outside of the valley; Yosemite Valley
